net.antidot.api.search

Class BasicTextFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.antidot.api.search.BasicTextFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextFormatter

    public class BasicTextFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextFormatter
    Basic string formatter.

    Simple formatter which add <strong> tags around highlighted words.

    For example, if specific word 'foo' is looked for through Antidot search engine, this word will be highlighted in title and abstract of the results.

    It is highly recommended to implement your own formatter for better word highlighting.

      • trunc

        public java.lang.String trunc()
        Description copied from interface: TextFormatter
        Format truncated text.

        When title or abstract is too long, it is truncated. This method allows to specify which text will represent this truncation.
        ... characters are usually used in such case.
